docs.snippet: Marine C-130 cargo aircraft lumbering into the airport here in total darkness each night have carried in troops, equipment, water and, now, large amounts of American dollars.    The cash -- the exact amount is something of a secret -- represents a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Marine C-130 cargo aircraft lumbering into the airport here in total darkness each night have carried in troops, equipment, water and, now, large amounts of American dollars. The cash -- the exact amount is something of a secret -- represents a new beginning in the American war in Afghanistan. After relentlessly attacking the Taliban's political and military stronghold here in Kandahar, the marine-led force occupying the airport has set about rebuilding it, providing a welcome boost for the desperate local economy.
docs.abstract: Marine cargo planes are carrying in large amounts of American dollars for use by marines in rebuilding Kandahar, Afghanistan, airport, providing welcome boost for desperate local economy; marines occupying airport are turning it into hub for military goods and eventually for relief supplies; seek to provide work for Afghans (M)

headline.main: Recipe for Rebuilding: Afghan Muscle, Marine Planning, Lots of Dollars

docs.snippet: Hundreds of Christian students marched in Beirut demanding an end to what they called the Syrian military occupation of Lebanon. Most of the demonstrators were supporters of Michel Aoun, an army general who lost a conflict against Syrian troops du...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Christian students marched in Beirut demanding an end to what they called the Syrian military occupation of Lebanon. Most of the demonstrators were supporters of Michel Aoun, an army general who lost a conflict against Syrian troops during the 1975-90 civil war and is now in exile. The Syrian Army entered Lebanon in 1976 and emerged as the dominant power after the civil war ended. The Lebanese government says the military presence is necessary, especially since Lebanon is officially in a state of war with Israel.
docs.abstract: Hundreds of Lebanese Christian students march in Beirut demanding end to what they call Syrian military occupation of Lebanon (S)

headline.main: World Briefing | Middle East: Lebanon: Anti-Syria Demonstration
